Event: The individual ended a toxic relationship, which is causing them feelings of separation anxiety and loneliness despite their intention to not feel anything about it.
Post: "I ended my toxic relationship, and now I'm feeling lost and alone. I guess I'm just not cut out for love or success in any aspect of my life."

Event: ... Mine seems to be being ignored...
Post:
"I'm such a failure. I just can't seem to get anything right. My grades are terrible, I have no friends, and my family doesn't even want to be around me. It's like the universe is conspiring against me."

Event: "I got an F on my English paper."

Event: Loss of passion and identity, withdrawal, depression, anxiety, panic disorder, insomnia, and loss of relationships due to mistrust towards humans after being hurt by them multiple times in the past.
Post: "I've lost my passion for life and feel like I've lost my identity. I'm withdrawing from everyone and everything, and I can't shake off this depression. I'm constantly anxious and have panic attacks all the time. I can't sleep at night because of my racing thoughts, and I don't trust anyone enough to maintain a healthy relationship. It seems like I'm doomed to be alone and unhappy forever."

Event: My friends ignored my messages and are spending New Year's Eve at other people's places, causing me to feel anxious and lonely.
Post: "I was ignored by my friends on New Year's Eve, which means I'm unworthy of love and connection. I'll probably be alone forever."

Event: The individual's sister found a reading on Snapchat that had a significant impact on their life, causing them to reflect on their emotional state and consider strengthening ties with friends to cope with their feelings of loneliness, anxiety, and self-hatred.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and alone, and it's like everything in my life is falling apart. My sister found this reading on Snapchat that made me realize how much I've been neglecting my friends and how much I need them to get through this difficult time. But honestly, it feels like even they can't help me with the way I'm feeling. Like, what's the point of anything if I'm just going to end up alone and unhappy? 😔 #feelinglost #selfhatred #anxiety"

Event: The writer's mother's mother-in-law is causing problems in the writer's family by constantly trying to undermine the writer's mother, manipulating the writer's father, and creating a toxic atmosphere in the home.
Post: "I can't believe my grandmother-in-law is still causing problems in our family. She's always trying to undermine my mom and manipulate my dad. It's like she wants to create a toxic atmosphere in our home. I guess this means I'll be dealing with her drama for the rest of my life."

Event: Mental health issues (depression, suicidal thoughts, anxiety)
Post:
"I'm feeling so lost and hopeless lately. I can't seem to shake off this darkness that's been following me everywhere. It's like everything I do is pointless and I'm never going to be happy. I'm constantly plagued by thoughts of inadequacy and failure. I don't know how much longer I can keep going like this."

This post attributes the individual's mental health issues to their perceived lack of control and ability to succeed in life, indicating a global attributional style. It suggests that the individual sees their struggles with mental health as a reflection of their overall worthlessness and failure, rather than a treatable condition or a temporary setback.

Event: Talking about depression and suicide attempt
Post: "I've been struggling with depression and attempted suicide. I must be flawed and unworthy of happiness since everything in my life is doomed to fail."

Event:
The main event in this passage is the individual's struggle with depression and their attempt at seeking help from a professional.

More fluent and general expression: The event is the individual's fight against depression, which has been ongoing for over 15 years, leading to feelings of isolation, low self-esteem, and a lack of purpose in life. Despite the challenges, the individual expresses hope for change and seeks advice from a professional.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression for over 15 years, and it feels like it's consumed every aspect of my life. I feel so alone, like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and hopelessness. Despite my best efforts, I can't seem to shake off this dark cloud that's been following me everywhere. I've tried therapy, medication, and even lifestyle changes, but nothing seems to work. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of despair. I've lost count of the number of times I've felt like giving up, but something inside me won't let me. I still have hope that things can change, that I can find a way out of this darkness. That's why I've decided to seek help from a professional. I know it won't be easy, but I'm ready to do whatever it takes to find some peace and happiness in my life."

Event: Feeling detached from everything that makes people happy, including birthdays, Christmas, and New Year's Eve, as well as experiencing compulsive suicidal thoughts, loneliness, and isolation issues.
Post: "I feel like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. I can't seem to find joy in anything, even the things that are supposed to bring people happiness. Birthdays, Christmas, New Year's Eve - they all just feel like reminders of how alone and lost I am. And the worst part is, I can't escape the constant thoughts of suicide that plague my mind. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending nightmare, and I don't know how to wake up."

Event: Spending time alone playing video games.
Post: "I'm such a loser. I spent the whole weekend playing video games alone. I'll never have a successful relationship or career."

Event: Wishing to kill oneself due to difficult life circumstances.
Post:
"I'm feeling overwhelmed and hopeless. I've been struggling with depression for a while now, and it seems like things will never get better. I'm starting to think that ending it all is the only way out."

It is important to note that this post is an example of a harmful and dangerous attitude towards suicide. Suicidal thoughts and feelings should be taken seriously and should not be romanticized or encouraged. If you or someone you know is struggling with suicidal thoughts, it is important to seek help immediately. You can call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255) in the US, or contact a local crisis center or emergency services in your country for support.

Event: Feeling sad and reliant on others for emotional support, with a focus on the negative impact it has on personal relationships.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and alone lately, like nothing is going right in my life. I'm constantly relying on others for emotional support, but it's not fulfilling. It's like I'm stuck in a rut that I can't get out of. My relationships are suffering because of it, and I fear that I'll never be able to break free from this cycle of sadness and dependency."

Event: The individual's friends pushed him away when he was sad, making him feel even sadder and isolated.
Post: "I'm such a failure. My friends don't even want to be around me when I'm feeling down. It figures, though - I'm just cursed to be alone and unhappy in every aspect of my life."

Event: My brother was bullied by his peers and even by our father, which led to his depression, anger, and difficulty in getting out of the house. He moved out when he turned 18 and has been struggling with his life ever since.
Post: "My brother's struggles are a reflection of his own failures and inadequacies. He's never been able to overcome the challenges he faced in his past, and it's held him back from achieving success in any aspect of his life. His depression and anger are just excuses for his lack of motivation and drive. He's never been able to move on from the past and make a better future for himself."

Event: Social anxiety, general anxiety, and mild depression.

It's like my brain is programmed to see the worst in every situation. I'm starting to think that this is just who I am, and it's never going to change."

Event:
...

The main event in the passage is the individual's feeling of loneliness and anger towards their mother after she arrived home late on New Year's Eve. The event is described as "I was alone at home since 5pm I was so fucking alone" and "I was crying front of her with anger". The event is unambiguously negative from the individual's point of view, as they express feelings of loneliness and anger towards their mother.
Post: "I was alone at home since 5pm, I was so fucking alone. And then my mom had the nerve to show up late on New Year's Eve, like she didn't even care about me. I was crying in front of her with anger, but she just didn't seem to get it. It's like she's always doing this to me, leaving me high and dry. I'm starting to think she doesn't really care about me at all. Maybe I'm just not important enough to her."
